title: Group
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, certain monsters have a tendency to appear in **groups**. Due to this, they are more common than their [monster frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency") would imply.

A "large" group consists of 2-11 monsters and a "small" group of 1-4.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) If more than one monster is generated, the number of additional monsters is divided by 4 for players of level 1 or 2, and halved for players of level 3 or 4, but is always at least one.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Extra monsters are never [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) If a monster created as part of a group would be peaceful, it's skipped; this can effectively reduce the group size for some monsters.

A common [strategy](/wiki/Strategy "Strategy") for killing monster groups in NetHack is to lure them into a [corridor](/wiki/Corridor "Corridor") or [doorway](/wiki/Doorway "Doorway"), so only one member of the group can attack the player at a time, preventing the group from overwhelming the player.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Monsters that appear in small groups](#Monsters_that_appear_in_small_groups)

- [2 Monsters that appear in large groups](#Monsters_that_appear_in_large_groups)

- [3 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM monsters that appear in small groups](#SLASH.27EM_monsters_that_appear_in_small_groups)
  - [3.2 SLASH'EM monsters that appear in large groups](#SLASH.27EM_monsters_that_appear_in_large_groups)
  - [3.3 SLASH'EM monsters that appear in very large groups](#SLASH.27EM_monsters_that_appear_in_very_large_groups)

- [4 References](#References)

## Monsters that appear in small groups

These monsters have a 1⁄2 chance of appearing in groups of 2-4:

- a [giant ant](/wiki/Giant_ant "Giant ant")
- a [soldier ant](/wiki/Soldier_ant "Soldier ant")
- a [fire ant](/wiki/Fire_ant "Fire ant")
- c [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice")
- d [jackal](/wiki/Jackal "Jackal")
- d [coyote](/wiki/Coyote "Coyote")
- d [wolf](/wiki/Wolf "Wolf")
- d [winter wolf cub](/wiki/Winter_wolf_cub "Winter wolf cub")
- d [warg](/wiki/Warg "Warg")
- d [hell hound pup](/wiki/Hell_hound_pup "Hell hound pup")
- q [rothe](/wiki/Rothe "Rothe")
- r [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat")
- r [giant rat](/wiki/Giant_rat "Giant rat")
- s [cave spider](/wiki/Cave_spider "Cave spider")
- x [grid bug](/wiki/Grid_bug "Grid bug")
- A [couatl](/wiki/Couatl "Couatl")
- B [bat](/wiki/Bat "Bat")
- G [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster\) "Gnome (monster)")
- H [stone giant](/wiki/Stone_giant "Stone giant")
- H [hill giant](/wiki/Hill_giant "Hill giant")
- H [fire giant](/wiki/Fire_giant "Fire giant")
- H [frost giant](/wiki/Frost_giant "Frost giant")
- H [storm giant](/wiki/Storm_giant "Storm giant")
- K [Kop Sergeant](/wiki/Kop_Sergeant "Kop Sergeant")
- O [ogre](/wiki/Ogre "Ogre")
- Y [ape](/wiki/Ape "Ape")
- Z [orc zombie](/wiki/Orc_zombie "Orc zombie")
- Z [dwarf zombie](/wiki/Dwarf_zombie "Dwarf zombie")
- Z [elf zombie](/wiki/Elf_zombie "Elf zombie")
- Z [human zombie](/wiki/Human_zombie "Human zombie")
- @ [Woodland-elf](/wiki/Woodland-elf "Woodland-elf")
- @ [Green-elf](/wiki/Green-elf "Green-elf")
- @ [Grey-elf](/wiki/Grey-elf "Grey-elf")
- @ [elf-lord](/wiki/Elf-lord "Elf-lord")
- @ [soldier](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier")
- @ [sergeant](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant")
- @ [watchman](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman")
- & [erinys](/wiki/Erinys "Erinys")
- & [barbed devil](/wiki/Barbed_devil "Barbed devil")
- & [vrock](/wiki/Vrock "Vrock")
- & [hezrou](/wiki/Hezrou "Hezrou")
- & [bone devil](/wiki/Bone_devil "Bone devil")
- ; [piranha](/wiki/Piranha "Piranha")

## Monsters that appear in large groups

With a 2 in 3 chance, they're generated in groups of 2-11; otherwise, a group size of 2-4 is used. The average group size is thus 51⁄3.

- a [killer bee](/wiki/Killer_bee "Killer bee")
- i [manes](/wiki/Manes "Manes")
- i [lemure](/wiki/Lemure "Lemure")
- o [orc](/wiki/Orc "Orc")
- o [hill orc](/wiki/Hill_orc "Hill orc")
- o [Mordor orc](/wiki/Mordor_orc "Mordor orc")
- o [Uruk-hai](/wiki/Uruk-hai "Uruk-hai")
- K [Keystone Kop](/wiki/Keystone_Kop "Keystone Kop")
- S [garter snake](/wiki/Garter_snake "Garter snake")
- S [water moccasin](/wiki/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin")

## SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds "very large" groups of size 2-21.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

### SLASH'EM monsters that appear in small groups

- a [giant tick](/wiki/Giant_tick "Giant tick")
- a [giant flea](/wiki/Giant_flea "Giant flea")
- a [snow ant](/wiki/Snow_ant "Snow ant")
- a [giant louse](/wiki/Giant_louse "Giant louse")
- a [tsetse fly](/wiki/Tsetse_fly "Tsetse fly")
- a [migo warrior](/wiki/Migo_warrior "Migo warrior")
- c [chicken](/wiki/Chicken "Chicken")

- q [goat](/wiki/Goat "Goat")
- q [squealer](/wiki/Squealer "Squealer")
- q [mangler](/wiki/Mangler "Mangler")
- s [recluse spider](/wiki/Recluse_spider "Recluse spider")
- w [larva](/wiki/Larva "Larva")
- w [maggot](/wiki/Maggot "Maggot")
- w [dung worm](/wiki/Dung_worm "Dung worm")
- w [acid worm](/wiki/Acid_worm "Acid worm")
- x [spark bug](/wiki/Spark_bug "Spark bug")
- x [arc bug](/wiki/Arc_bug "Arc bug")
- x [lightning bug](/wiki/Lightning_bug "Lightning bug")
- z [wallaroo](/wiki/Wallaroo "Wallaroo")
- z [kangaroo](/wiki/Kangaroo "Kangaroo")
- B [rhumbat](/wiki/Rhumbat "Rhumbat")
- B [hellbat](/wiki/Hellbat "Hellbat")
- B [mongbat](/wiki/Mongbat "Mongbat")
- B [harpy](/wiki/Harpy "Harpy")
- B [nightgaunt](/wiki/Nightgaunt_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightgaunt (SLASH'EM)")
- @ [drow](/wiki/Drow "Drow")
- & [bar-lgura](/wiki/Bar-lgura "Bar-lgura")
- & [chasme](/wiki/Chasme "Chasme")
- & [babau](/wiki/Babau "Babau")

### SLASH'EM monsters that appear in large groups

- a [migo drone](/wiki/Migo_drone "Migo drone")
- a [yellow jacket](/wiki/Yellow_jacket "Yellow jacket")
- a [black wasp](/wiki/Black_wasp "Black wasp")
- a [giant wasp](/wiki/Giant_wasp "Giant wasp")
- h [deep one](/wiki/Deep_one "Deep one")
- o [war orc](/wiki/War_orc "War orc")
- o [great orc](/wiki/Great_orc "Great orc")
- o [snow orc](/wiki/Snow_orc "Snow orc")
- o [demon orc](/wiki/Demon_orc "Demon orc")
- r [hellrat](/wiki/Hellrat "Hellrat")
- B [athol](/wiki/Athol "Athol")
- B [mobat](/wiki/Mobat "Mobat")
- Z [gug](/wiki/Gug "Gug")
- & [spined devil](/wiki/Spined_devil "Spined devil")

### SLASH'EM monsters that appear in very large groups

- g [jermlaine](/wiki/Jermlaine "Jermlaine")
- @ [gibberling](/wiki/Gibberling "Gibberling")
- @ [grimlock](/wiki/Grimlock "Grimlock")

html:
Group

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, certain monsters have a tendency to appear in groups. Due to this, they are more common than their monster frequency would imply.

A "large" group consists of 2-11 monsters and a "small" group of 1-4.[1] If more than one monster is generated, the number of additional monsters is divided by 4 for players of level 1 or 2, and halved for players of level 3 or 4, but is always at least one.[2] Extra monsters are never peaceful.[3] If a monster created as part of a group would be peaceful, it's skipped; this can effectively reduce the group size for some monsters.

A common strategy for killing monster groups in NetHack is to lure them into a corridor or doorway, so only one member of the group can attack the player at a time, preventing the group from overwhelming the player.

Contents

  • 1 Monsters that appear in small groups
  • 2 Monsters that appear in large groups
  • 3 SLASH'EM
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM monsters that appear in small groups
    • 3.2 SLASH'EM monsters that appear in large groups
    • 3.3 SLASH'EM monsters that appear in very large groups
  • 4 References

With a 2 in 3 chance, they're generated in groups of 2-11; otherwise, a group size of 2-4 is used. The average group size is thus 51⁄3.

  • i manes
